item.title: alan-turing
item.description: Alan Turing Alan Mathison Turing 23rd of June 1912 to 7th of June 1954. Mathematician. Pardoned in 2013. Created the concept of a turing machine.

item.title: Depth-First Search
item.description: Depth-First Search It allows us to explore nodes and edges of a |graph. The traversal will go as far as possible down a path until a dead end is reached.

item.title: Foundation of Algorithm Analysis
item.description: Foundation of Algorithm Analysis Running time. Pseudo-code. Counting primitive operations. Running Time Varies with the input and typically grows with the input size.

item.title: Introduction to Algorithms
item.description: Introduction to Algorithms An algorithm is a set of steps for solving a problem. It is a well-defined computational procedure that takes some value(s) as input and produces some value(s) as output.

item.description: Turing Machines Turning machine manipulate symbols on a strip of tape according to a table of rules and it is capable of implementing any computer algorithm.

item.title: User Models and Conceptual Design
item.description: User Models and Conceptual Design Making Sense of the World Transparent objects expose their functions, for example a bicycle. Opaque objects however, hide their functions.
